experience: You and David both know Paul Falkenbach, Julie Mifsud, and 3 others

David worked at National Sign Systems after you started

• Manage Active Directory (2008R2) and Exchange 2003/2010 environment for an 11,000+ user global network• Administer and maintain Cisco IronPort C360 email gateway appliances at multiple sites, email compliance archive servers using Hewlett Packard IAP (RISS), manage BlackBerry Enterprise Servers for 300+ Blackberry mobile users & 4500+ ActiveSync mobile users through Exchange• Maintain 75 Windows servers on HP hardware and 300 virtual servers on VMware and install new systems as needed• Assist in maintaining 3 VMWare datacenters on 23 ESXi 5.0 hosts• Provide tier 3 support to resolve user messaging, software and networking issues• Assisted in design and execution of Exchange 2010/Lync 2010 migration• Deployed and manage Solar Winds NPM, APM, IPAM, LEM, Configuration Manager and Patch Manager• Manage McAfee ePO, Credent encryption software, Microsoft Certificate Services, Microsoft ADFS• Manage NetApp FAS3140 & FAS2240 CIFS shares (OS release 7.3.x and 8.1)

• Sole responsibility for all aspects of daily administration including end user support and desktop/laptop support and remote users and remote offices connected with Sonicwall VPN devices• Built  and maintained HP and Dell servers• Regular backup regimen using BackupExec plus experience with Symantec Endpoint Protection, Symantec Endpoint Encryption and Symantec System Recovery • Administered Sonicwall firewalls and Barracuda spam firewalls• Administered Cisco routers, HP switches and installed/configured Riverbed WAN accelerators• Maintained the NEX phone system• Performed migration from Windows 2000 Active Directory/Exchange 2000 to Windows Server 2008 Active Directory and Exchange 2007• Built and maintained Citrix servers as needed to support critical applications• Assisted in maintaining Microsoft Dynamics ERP application, including building and maintaining Citrix servers that hosted it.• Implemented several new technologies including MS SharePoint, Windows Server Update Services, Microsoft Hyper-V Server 2008 and Blackberry Server

• Responsible for all help desk referrals involving networking issues using in-house help desk software • Performed daily administration tasks of setting up new users and groups, creating/modifying group policy, setting NTFS permissions, print queues, etc.• Responsible for building new Windows servers, regular upgrades on server applications, and applying OS updates and patches•Supervised 3 PC Analysts in the imaging and deployment of new PC’s and the management of over 800 devices using Altiris Deployment Solution• Managed migration from a Novell/Windows 9x environment to Windows 2000 Active Directory with Windows XP & HP thin clients• Migrated over 1000 mailboxes from Exchange 2000 to Exchange 2003 and managed the new Exchange 2003 environment• Implemented network monitoring using Solar Winds Network Performance Monitor• Evaluated, installed and managed unified threat management (UTM) devices from Astaro for network security• Managed a 20 server Citrix farm• Managed the IBM Tivoli Storage Manager enterprise backup solution

• Responsible for teaching Microsoft Official Curriculum to network administrators• Taught courses in basic networking, MCSE preparation classes, Exchange, IIS, ISA, etc.• Consulted with customers regarding all aspects of network implementations, administration,   troubleshooting and migration• Migrated the franchise’s network from Novell to NT 4.0. Also migrated the mail system from  Groupwise to Exchange 5.5• Involved in troubleshooting in-house network problems, budgeting, documentation, and assisting  the facilities department in planning. • Assisted in hiring and managed the development of other technical trainers
recommendations: Office Manager at Direct Online Marketing
August 16, 2011, David reported directly to Blanche

Blanche was the best manager I've ever worked for, bar none. She always pushed me to become a better trainer but never made me feel micromanaged. She provided me with the tools and opportunities to excel in my job and I've never had a job before or since where I worked so hard or felt so happy. The team of trainers at New Horizons was a close-knit family and Blanche was the "Mom-glue" that made it all work. I was heartbroken when Blanche left us (not her choice and the downfall of that franchise in my opinion) and would go back to work for her in a heartbeat!

summary: I’m a seasoned professional with an extensive background in IT and education. I work well in a team environment and can assume leadership roles as needed. My education background helps me assist others in understanding technology and my patience developed through the years of working with a wide range of students, both adult and adolescent, lets me work well with anyone. I love to evaluate new technologies and I especially enjoy troubleshooting problems because they are like mystery novels to me and I love the feeling of figuring out the puzzle.Government Clearances: United States Government, Office of Personnel Management: Favorably adjudicated SSBI for Federal Bureau of Investigation, Customs and Border Protection, Immigration and Customs Enforcement and National Geospatial-Intelligence AgencyMultiple industry certifications since 1997 including Microsoft Certified Systems Engineer (MCSE: Messaging), Microsoft Certified Trainer (MCT), Cisco Certified Network Associate (CCNA), Certified Sonicwall Security Administrator (CSSA) and CompTIA Network Plus (Net+)
name: David Bouterse
